meanings.sent1: I always keep a backup flashlight in case the power goes out.
meanings.sent2: Having a backup plan is essential for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: My backup snack turned out to be everyone's favorite at the party.
meanings.sent4: She was the backup singer, but her voice shone brighter than the lead.
meanings.sent5: The backup generator kicked in just in time to save the day.

meanings.sent1: I will backup my friend in the upcoming debate.
meanings.sent2: It's important to backup your teammates during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to backup the kitten when it got scared of the vacuum.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words were like a backup for my confidence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher always backuped the students when they needed extra guidance.

meanings.definition: To make a copy of data for safekeeping
meanings.sent1: Remember to backup your important files regularly.
meanings.sent2: I will backup my photos to the cloud to ensure they are safe.
meanings.sent3: He decided to backup his work after losing a document last time.
meanings.sent4: She backuped the document just in time before the computer crashed.
meanings.sent5: The IT specialist showed me how to backup my data securely.

meanings.sent1: I will backup my friend in the soccer match tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The team captain always backuped his players during tough games.
meanings.sent3: The superhero backuped the police in catching the thief.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words backuped my decision to pursue my dream.
meanings.sent5: The mentor backuped the mentee throughout the learning process.
